website_summaries.verdict: Good for individuals or small businesses that don’t need heavy-duty binding.
pros: No struggle to thread binding through the clean holes
Doesn’t require a lot of physical effort to operate
Good budget unit for occasional binding
Can handle A4, legal, and letter paper sizes
cons: Unhelpful instructions mean you’ll need to search online for instruction videos

customer_reviews.title: Decent for what i need it for...
customer_reviews.text: This is definitely not something you want for the office of you are doing large binding jobs... however medium jobs... this is perfect... took me about 5 min to get the proper technique avid after that it was a breeze. I was able to punch 8-12 pages with ease and no more than 2 plastic cover sheets at a time. The spines that come with it are barely enough for 10 pages... purchase the half inch if you're doing roughly 70-80 pages...
customer_reviews.author: Mizz Abi

customer_reviews.title: This Binding Machine
customer_reviews.text: I am disappointed with this purchase. It seems as though the instruction manual included was not for this machine. It is punching very good but up to now about 2 months I am unable to bind anything. I looked for You Tube videos for this machine and saw none. I will have to do trial and error until I find a way to bind my documents. October 22, 2018 I looked at a video on the procedure to bind a document and was able to get it working properly. I like it now, but review the manual that are being sent to customers.
customer_reviews.author: Phyllis Roberts-knights

customer_reviews.title: Does a good job.
customer_reviews.text: Works well but the box had clearly been opened and resealed. The screw that holds the handle on, isn't long enough to screw in once you attach the handle. But as far as the function of the machine it does a good job with little effort to punch the holes and to attach the combs.
customer_reviews.author: AGF66

customer_reviews.title: It works, but is not the most high quality
customer_reviews.text: The unit was delivered with the handle assembled in the wrong position. Once we figured that out, we finally got it working. However, the lines used for alignment of the paper are not accurate. Don't expect the holes you cut to be very precise - they are not. It will be longer on one side of the paper than the other and it will be an awkward fit even for the binder on top that is part of this machine. There are better options out there, but this one is functional...barely.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: What a headache!
customer_reviews.text: By far one of the worst products I have purchased in a long time. After only 400 sheets the cutter became dull and would leave chads on the paper making it difficult to insert over the ring. To make matter worse the cutter would clog and you cant get the paper in there straight, making the punch 1/8" off. Then you have to make a new copy. If that wasnt bad enough once youve punched you cant get the paper out without ripping the punch. They say 12 sheets at once can be punched. baloney, maybe 6.
customer_reviews.author: Vinny

customer_reviews.title: I recommend you to buy this product...
customer_reviews.text: Perfect! So here's a hint! Before using the product be sure you try it first with a scratch paper so you'll know how to use it, adjust and etc... it's really easy to use just like 1...2...3... 21 ring holes is better than buying 19 holes because you can buy 19 or 21 ring combbind... if you just need 19 and you have 21 ring comb all you have to do is cut the ring combind and that's it!
customer_reviews.author: blueblink

customer_reviews.title: Leaves a partial hole at one end
customer_reviews.text: The binding machine worked for punching holes (although it takes a lot of effort to punch 12 pages at a time) and it holds the comb open to facilitate loading the pages to bind. But it leaves a partial hole at one end that is useless and looks awful. I'd read some reviews that mentioned the partial hole but I didn't see pictures to know what they were talking about. I've included pictures and hope they help others who are considering this item.
customer_reviews.author: C R Mills

customer_reviews.title: Broke after only 9 booklets
customer_reviews.text: Only did 9 books before breaking. Worked beautifully up to that point and I was impressed and happy.
customer_reviews.author: Linda S. Prather

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, cuts great, but weird
customer_reviews.text: The awkward thing is that the holes don’t measure out perfectly and so there is either a partial hole at the top or bottom but you have test sheet it every time. Why not just build this for a standard size everyday sheet of paper? Everyone in America uses 8andahalf by 11” paper. Kind of a weird counterintuitive miss
customer_reviews.author: DVIC

customer_reviews.title: It doesn't work! There are not words to describe ...
customer_reviews.text: It doesn't work! There are not words to describe my frustration that I should say here. I am a patient person. I am mechanically inclined. I am a sewer. No matter how I fix it, the ends of the spiral are high on one end and low on the other. It is impossible to thread them. The direction sheet is a joke. I had to go online and youtube it - still this is a disaster. AAAAAAAAAAAAHHHHHHH and ..... just fyi.... the binding combs that come with it are so small in diameter, they only accept about 5 sheets of paper.
customer_reviews.author: - Julie

customer_reviews.title: Great machine for the price!
customer_reviews.text: This binding machine is perfect for binding the proposals and presentations I assemble at work. When you first get it be sure to punch several pieces of paper as some oil residue is still on the machine. I punched some scrap paper 4-5 times and the residue was gone. Also the manual that comes with it is very minimal. As this is my first binding machine I had to watch a YouTube video to show me how to properly do the binding part. But for the price you can’t beat it.
customer_reviews.author: Brooke

customer_reviews.title: Great machine
customer_reviews.text: Great little machine. I love that you can do A4, legal or letter. I like it much better than the Fellows version which is BIGGER but can not do the longer page. It was a waste for me to buy the the Fellow machine - this is a much better machine for personal light work.
customer_reviews.author: oldgamer

customer_reviews.title: which made my thesis look dirty. If you are using "letter" size rather than ...
customer_reviews.text: Well, it does the job, but I think that it's rather overpriced considering. It left oil marks on my papers, which made my thesis look dirty. If you are using "letter" size rather than the European A4 you will have to snip the coils down to size and take care in punching the holes so as not to make the job look shoddy. I love the look: the lever and the typeface on the front of the machine; it looks better than other models. But I now wish I'd chosen an electronic binder.
customer_reviews.author: emma

customer_reviews.title: Not expecting it to last long
customer_reviews.text: Do not order this for business or commercial volume. I have found zero on-line information about Kenley named binders so no replacement parts are available (correct me if I am wrong). The instructions were ridiculously inadequate but found videos for other manufacturers helpful. Mine came with broken feet and tray holder. It still functions but wish I had not gone with Amazon Pick and spent more money on a machine that would be long lasting. Lesson learned...research product before buying. Shop smarter!
customer_reviews.author: Hobson

customer_reviews.title: works well
customer_reviews.text: Works well. I had to do some test sheets to find the proper line up when hole punching. I usually only hole punch 5 sheets or less, otherwise it tends to jam. Also when putting on binding ring, it usually holds up to maybe 400 sheets, and then I take off the packet off and just slide on the remaining sheets.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Can't use to full potential
customer_reviews.text: It's not sturdy and would never punch 12 pages. I was lucky to get 3 pages without it getting stuck. It did the job but def would have ordered something better had I known. I'll keep it but don't recommend it. Put in a few more $ and get yourself a better puncher.
customer_reviews.author: Sandy Palmer

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Very slick. Needed some time (and U-tube) to figure out how to put on the plastic combs, but after seeing how it's done, it became pretty easy. Would be very labor intensive and time consuming if you had 100's of documents to bind, but perfect if you only have 10 or 12 to do at a time. Keep in mind, that the major time constraint is the fact that only 12 sheets can be punched at a time, and the punched sheets need to be threaded onto the plastic comb by hand (the machine opens and closes the comb, but does not thread on the paper).
customer_reviews.author: Bill C.

customer_reviews.title: My First Binding Machine
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical about this binding machine at first. However, after practising with it for approximately an hour, I realized it is a very good machine for my family. I am satisfied with my purchase and would recommend it to anyone who wishes to own a binding machine. It seems to be durable and at the same time use it with care.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I highly recommended!
customer_reviews.text: This binding machine does the job ,and it is very inexpensive. I highly recommended it. I use it for my church. It punches wholes to up to 11 pages at a time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to make some recipe books for my family and myself in Aug. 2018. It broke in July 2019. Im disgusted with how cheaply things are made today that they can't last a year. I used it in Aug Sept and July. So after 3 uses it was broken.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Tricky.
customer_reviews.text: Durable. Tricky to make sure you don't punch your holes too close to the edge so don't try to punch a lot at one time. I found I had to order much larger combs than you would think to give you room to bind them, otherwise binding is a chore.
customer_reviews.author: Sandy

customer_reviews.title: Dosent work on Covers
customer_reviews.text: This binding machine works fine on copier paper and even card stock but does not do well on plastic covers even punching them one at a time. It does not give clean punches and often punches at an angle instead of stright. If all your using it for is paper or card stock it works fine.
customer_reviews.author: Rocky Caughron

customer_reviews.title: Great Machine for the Home and School
customer_reviews.text: I have worked with similar power driven machines for the office and heaver work. This one works well for home and school loads and the cost is reasonable.
customer_reviews.author: Robert J Apida

customer_reviews.title: It only cuts paper! what a waste
customer_reviews.text: It will not cut through the basic Clear Presentation Binding Covers. I feel deceived, Yes it is a paper cutter like they advertise, however I bought it to bind medical reports which require covers. they should be required to tell you not to think you can do complete work. So now it will be a Goodwill donation, what a waste of time and money.
customer_reviews.author: Dr Tim

customer_reviews.title: Good value for the price.
customer_reviews.text: This Binding Machine has been in our household for over a year and gets moderate use. We like it a lot! It is so convenient to be able to do our binding at home and not have to drive 25 miles to the nearest town to have this done. Easy to use and good value for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Joyce M

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: A gift for my daughter, who has used it multiple times and is thoroughly pleased with it. Small but heavy, but can be portable if needed.
customer_reviews.author: Jan Price

customer_reviews.title: I could not be more disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: When I received this machine, some of the tines had poked through the box. The tines were bent, and after attempting to straighten them, I was able to use the hole punching function, but found that it did not always punch the holes neatly or evenly. I could not get the binding part to work at all, I am returning it. Luckily a friend was able to borrow a binding machine at the last minute so we could complete our project. I could not be more disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Marlene W.

customer_reviews.title: Not so good
customer_reviews.text: Works very well at punching holes but the binding was beyond difficult and I ended up having to jury rig most of them. The instructions were not very helpful at all.
customer_reviews.author: Morty

customer_reviews.title: Nice price point
customer_reviews.text: Works great and I haven’t had any issues using it. I am happy with my purchase so far.
customer_reviews.author: Jody

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use. The binding part... the handle is pushed backwards. The instructions are of no help as they are virtually non existent. The good news is that with a quick search of the web and watching a couple of videos I figured it out. After that it was a piece of cake! Works well and serves my needs perfectly. The instruction issue causes me to deduct one star.
customer_reviews.author: Derrick Lay

customer_reviews.title: I tried it on card stock paper and it works just fine.
customer_reviews.text: I just got the binder and only performed basic test so far. It came packaged well without any missing pieces or instructions. I tried it on card stock paper and it works just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Harry Hippee

customer_reviews.title: Great binding machine!
customer_reviews.text: I love this binding machine. I am a special education teacher and bind a lot of adapted books. I have used this machine to bind close to 100 books so far with no problems or issues.
customer_reviews.author: Billie Jo Diehl

customer_reviews.title: Great classroom binder for my students
customer_reviews.text: I bought it to make cursive books for my class. Them machine worked perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Terry Ann Whitby

customer_reviews.title: Nice for Professional Presentations
customer_reviews.text: Makes presentations really professional looking. Watch the video to understand how to work it because it's not exactly intuitive.
customer_reviews.author: Macdonald

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: The machine was better than I expected it could be.
customer_reviews.author: Jim M

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money
customer_reviews.text: Mine broke within the first 20 minutes of using it, and now only pinches the paper so I have feed the comb in by hand. Save up for a better one
customer_reviews.author: Spartin00392

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: The quality of this machine is superb for the $$$. I have spent more on a machine that was plastic. Great product
customer_reviews.author: Cindy Black

customer_reviews.title: This is the machine to invest in
customer_reviews.text: This machine is great for small jobs! It is worth every penny! I have no complaints. For me... we put together 100 booklets ( 15 pages) with no issues! Not sure what the lower scoring reviews were looking for, but it was efficient for me!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: needs better design
customer_reviews.text: clumsy and cuts to close to edge on one side or the other. I have a different brand in other office that I prefer.
customer_reviews.author: NancyReyes

customer_reviews.title: Incorrect cut - doesn’t line up
customer_reviews.text: The holes are not correct when you cut standard size paper. A waste of my money. I can’t use it. Very unprofessional presentation.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice get the job done a little at a time ...
customer_reviews.text: Nice get the job done a little at a time work as well as the bigger machines but slower and a lot cheaper that the bigger ones
customer_reviews.author: Loliz productions

customer_reviews.title: Creative Juices are Flowing
customer_reviews.text: This is just what we wanted. My husband draws, and we make coloring books for the grandkids. This works great, as it allows the books to lay flat for easier coloring.
customer_reviews.author: Sunflower

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: I was disappointed to receive this item and realized it had been returned to the shipper previously and had paper jammed inside of the machine. It was obviously defective and very cheaply made.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: This machine is horrible. The arm does not fit properly and I can't return it even though I just opened it to use it. I am a teacher and feel so cheated by this defective machine.
customer_reviews.author: howard

customer_reviews.title: but it Worked great.
customer_reviews.text: Came in a resealed box, so i was skeptical, but it Worked great.
customer_reviews.author: James L. Black

customer_reviews.title: Good products and great price
customer_reviews.text: The item is sturdy and easy to use. For the money, it is a good investment. It will pay off after just 15 binding jobs at a copy store.I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Ensar Demirkan

customer_reviews.title: Great product! Great value!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic value! Great product for a decent price! Easy to use..if you don't understand YouTube a video and bada Bing bada boom..you're a pro! Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Tina Minehart

customer_reviews.title: Great quality and price
customer_reviews.text: Daughter was very happy with this product, very happy with the quality and price
customer_reviews.author: Lyn

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: It was hard to figure out how to use it at first
customer_reviews.author: C Denice

customer_reviews.title: Read everything before using it.
customer_reviews.text: I liked the ease of setting it up and using it right away.
customer_reviews.author: tetabug5

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: Used to bind 20 page books with cardstock covers. Worked great for my uses.
customer_reviews.author: Meagan Chapman

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: Used two times before it broke. It will not punch holes properly any longer. Tried to send back and could not find the seller.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Junk!
customer_reviews.text: Arrived with brown oil on the cutting edge. Ruined my papers! Also did not align holes. Piece of JUNK.
customer_reviews.author: Donn

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This is a sturdy, well-designed comb binding machine. It includes extra details that are smart and useful.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: Works and Functions.
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Will punch and bind with ease. We use this on a monthly basis and it is holding up great.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan B.

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Took a bit to figure it out but the product works great.
customer_reviews.author: natoshya reed

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Worked good for a very short bit. Kept catching and bending teeth
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Its a good one. Not the best I think
customer_reviews.text: Its a good one. Not the best I think. but worth the price. For small works great. As I just bought it, I dont know how much it'll last. I'll see :-)
customer_reviews.author: ALCIDIEL LEOPOLDINO

customer_reviews.title: Kenley Binding Machine Paper Punch Binder with
customer_reviews.text: Much better than the first one I bought 5 years ago .
customer_reviews.author: Rita F

customer_reviews.title: no.no.no!
customer_reviews.text: Wow, This think was a disappointment. Should have known when the product came used. Someone else already returned it . Would barley punch 6 pages, and the comb would not let go. Had to rip the books out of it, and bind by hand.
customer_reviews.author: OZ Group

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This worked great for binding items for work. Great Value
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The machine works great and is very easy to use
customer_reviews.text: The machine works great and is very easy to use. And the price was exceptionally good. And we received it 4 days prior to when we were told they would arrive.
customer_reviews.author: Japan Sapporo Mission

customer_reviews.title: It's a good piece of equipment too bad they didn't have some ...
customer_reviews.text: It's a good piece of equipment too bad they didn't have some basic how to directions with it or it would get a five-star
customer_reviews.author: David Woodland

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: It takes a whole lot of space and and not very sharp, I may send it back!
customer_reviews.author: Janie Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: The Kenley binder and paper punch worked like a charm. It made the everyday book binding a success.
customer_reviews.author: Mary J.

customer_reviews.title: Very useful information and it's good to know it can be ...
customer_reviews.text: Very useful information and it's good to know it can be used for 8.5x11 paper. I'm yet to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Christine Addotey

customer_reviews.title: help?!
customer_reviews.text: I can not get this machine to cut the wholes. What I doing wrong?
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Maybe spend more
customer_reviews.text: Probably ok for price, however no instruction manual. Combs provided of poor quality, minimal selection in size
customer_reviews.author: Sally Hicks

customer_reviews.title: ... bought did not work however the second one works great for what I need
customer_reviews.text: The first one I bought did not work however the second one works great for what I need.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ... the price the quality would have been a little better. The product had already been opened and the ...
customer_reviews.text: I thought for the price the quality would have been a little better. The product had already been opened and the box was in pretty bad shape.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Directions are poor, had to go to YouTube to learn how to use it. Otherwise it works great.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce MacDonald

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Was very easy to use strait out of the box. Looked up how to video on YouTube
customer_reviews.author: zenon hunt

customer_reviews.title: this product is wonderful! I bought this machine just recently to bind ...
customer_reviews.text: For the value, this product is wonderful! I bought this machine just recently to bind books that my students made ... once I figured out how the binding machine worked, I had no issue using the product. My only complaint is instruction manual is not clear (to the layman) about the parts of each machine and how to properly load the combs. Luckily, if you have some common sense it was relatively easy to figure out on my own. I would purchase this product again.
customer_reviews.author: julia

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Worked well. Easy to use. Did what I needed it to do.
customer_reviews.author: CyndiT

customer_reviews.title: It's like they designed it to punch a piece of paper ...
customer_reviews.text: It's unusable. You can't punch a standard 8.5"X11" piece of paper without one of the edge cuts being cut off. There is no adjustment to make it fit a regular piece of paper. It's like they designed it to punch a piece of paper that's 11.25" long.
customer_reviews.author: FishinFreaks

customer_reviews.title: I thought it would be an all metal body. ...
customer_reviews.text: I thought it would be an all metal body. It's not. I returned it and got an all metal one.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Castanon

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this machine
customer_reviews.text: I returned this machine as it is not able to punch a standard 8.5 x 11 piece of paper! It leaves one punch at the top open. It also did not work with the combs I had and I could not figure out a way to open them up since they were thicker than the white ones that come with it. It comes with 10 thin, white combs that seem to be the only size that this machine works with. The punching sucks and would frequently cut off the holes. Waste of money- I'm not sure if this one was defective or what but I wouldn't risk it.
customer_reviews.author: Daniella M.

customer_reviews.title: This machine arrived damage
customer_reviews.text: The handle on this machine did not work properly the teeth did not open up in order for me to use it
customer_reviews.author: paul

customer_reviews.title: Not as sturdy as I would like
customer_reviews.text: Suits are present needs. Not as sturdy as I would like, but I was used to a heavier duty machine which lasted over 30 years. Don't do as much binding as I did before and will be retiring soon so it should last.
customer_reviews.author: Roderick L. MacKenzie

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Looks like it will work just fine haven't used it yet
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: When the machine arrived, three of the spokes that hold the plastic combs were bent. I first tried to use it on only two pieces of typing paper. I couldn't even get the paper out without tugging, which tore the paper. I am returning it.
customer_reviews.author: Linguae Magistra

customer_reviews.title: Not Recommended. You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.text: Product broke on the first use and the 30 day return window had passed by the time we used it for our first project. I recommend buying a different brand. We purchased this because of the price being so cheap. Apparently, the cheap price translated to a cheap product. We will be purchasing another unit but it will be a better brand product.
customer_reviews.author: Ed Hunter

product_meta.title: Kenley Binding Machine Paper Punch Binder with Starter Combs Set - 21 Hole / 450 Sheets
